instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.PP5V_S4RS3: What is PP5V_S4RS3? PP5V_S4RS3 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.PP1V05_S0:
What is PP1V05_S0? The PP1V05_S0 power rail is for various components on the logic board that require a 1.05V supply voltage in the S0 (on) state. This voltage rail is likely to be used by the CPU (for VCCIO), PCH (Platform Controller Hub).

.
definitions.PP1V2_S3: What is PP1V2_S3? PP1V2_S3 is a 1.2v power rail present when the machine is in an S3 suspend to RAM state.
definitions.PP3V3_S5_REG: What is PP3V3_S5_REG? PP3V3_S5_REG is a 3.3v power rail present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H_REG: What is PP3V42_G3H_REG? PP3V42_G3H_REG is another way to say PP3V42_G3H. PP3V42_G3H_REG and PP3V42_G3H are a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .

threads.title: 820-000165 Not video
threads.message:
this macbook does not give video, it does not have usb data, it turns on and turns the fan, it does not give a green light.

some story: entry with humidity computer turned on with video but backlight worked sometimes. It had some resistors <RESISTOR>R5177</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R5178</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R5179</RESISTOR> corroded, I changed them and it did not give video again, check resistors and they are well placed, I do not know when placing resistors affect the smc that are nearby. Any suggestions


<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H_REG</SIGNAL>= 3.41                                         
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>=8.58
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL>=5.1V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_REG</SIGNAL>=3.3V
<SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0</SIGNAL>=1.05
<SIGNAL>PP1V2_S3</SIGNAL>=1.2
<SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU_PH1</SIGNAL>=1.81
<SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU_PH2</SIGNAL>=1.81
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>=3.3V
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL>=3.3V

threads.title: 820-000165 Not video
threads.message:
You should reball SMC anyway.
Check for more corroded components also.

For the Magsafe light issue, inspect J9500 pins and solders.
Try known good LIO board/flex.
